comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: OP, after reviewing your website, I am sorry to say that I'm not impressed by what I saw. The content is weak and poorly organized; it doesn't engage the reader or convey what you're trying to sell. You simply listed a few online casinos and copied partial reviews from other websites. I don't see anything about your website that sets it apart or makes it worth reading, and I'm concerned that you havenâ€™t done enough research on the online casino industry to create a successful review site. If I may suggest, you need to do more research and find out what makes an online casino review site successful. Make sure that you fluctuate between adding objective facts and subjective opinions. It's also important to note which online casinos you think are the best and why, rather than simply listing your top picks without explaining why.Â The design of your website is also very basic and doesn't give off an impression of professionalism or credibility, and the overall user experience is not pleasant. This is just my honest opinion, but I would recommend starting fresh and rewriting practically all the content on your website. Start interacting with the online casino industry on other platforms so that you can have a better understanding of it and what your audience looks like. You are also going to need to create an engaging design by hiring a professional designer. On top of this, you should also use SEO to improve your ranking on search engines, as this will attract more readers to your site. This may be a lot of work, but if you want your website to succeed, I think these are the things you should start doing from now on.
